text: The Queen's Indian defence is an important defence to 1.d4. It features a fianchetto of Black's QB. It starts as follows: :1.d4 Nf6 :2.c4 e6 :3.Nf3 b6 ::and now 4e3, 4Nc3 and 4g3 are all possible. So is 4.a3, which prepares 5.Nc3 by preventing Black's 5...Bb4. This is the most usual line: :4.g3 Bb7 (4...Ba6 is also played here) :5.Bg2 Be7 :6.0-0 0-0 :7.Nc3 Ne4 :8.Qc2 Nxc3 :9.Qxc3 Category:Chess openings
title: Queen's Indian defence
